Reviews.Title: “The best first impression from the travel!”
Reviews.Author: OlgaTOK
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 5am and were warmly welcomed by the staff of the Artefes hotel. The turkish tea and coffee were served and we had a chance to enjoy a great view of the sunrise from the terrace of the hotel. We were excited by Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia, which were 5 minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel's building is a historical place in Ottoman style with very nice exterior and interior. Special thanks to Murat, who gave us a suite room with a seaview and a balcony. The room was very clean, light and cosy. The breakfast was very tasty, especially bubliks. Meal was very fresh and for all tastes. The hotel was very calm and guests were also adequate. We highly recommend also to use hammam and massage - very clean and proffessional service. It was our first trip to Istambul, we felt in love with the city and definately be back and stay at the same place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Sanjay S
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights in March 2012.my room was on ground floor ,room was clean .Breakfast was excellent since i was vegetarian lady staff(forgot her name) prepared potato dish for me.Best location near historic places within walkin distance of Blue mosque,topkapi palace and hagia sophia .Thanks to tunjay or tuncay for helping me out for my excursion tour,locating veg restaurant for me.All staff was helpfull .I will visit again and i recommend this nice hotel in part of Sultanhamet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Terrific Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MDMomof3
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Artefes Hotel in March 2012. Our room, a double on the second floor, was not large or fancy, but it was perfectly adequate. The bathroom had a nice shower but lacked a tub (I think hotels.com said it would have one). Everything was clean, and the bed was quite comfortable. The building is a very beautiful old Ottoman mansion with a spectacular roof garden offering vistas of the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque. Breakfast was a real treat. In addition to the usual breads and pastries, they had hard boiled eggs, yogurt, fresh fruit, and many delicious cheeses and olives. The cold-weather setting for breakfast was a large, well-lit restaurant with many windows on the top floor. What really makes this a terrific hotel option is its proximity to the sites. We were on a quiet street yet only two blocks from the Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, the Archeological Museum, and the tram. We easily walked to the Suleiman the Magnificant Mosque and the Grand Bazaar. Everything is convenient -- including public transportation that seamlessly got us to the airport on our departure for the equivalent of $3 apiece. There are many options in the Sultanahmet district, and they probably vary quite a bit in quality. This one is good value and served our needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place! Cute, Quiet, Charming”
Reviews.Author: StudentTraveler505
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quaint and very well maintained in this charming little part of Sultanhamet. It really is centrally located for all tourism sites that anyone would like to see in Istanbul as well as the tram - 3 blocks away! Breakfast was delicious and the staff was incredibly helpful with room arrangements, accommodating extra guests and setting up tour trips out of town. Very quiet street but close to restaurants and shopping. We had a large group from the States and Mr. Murat was exceedingly helpful. I recommend this place over all other spots in Istanbul - very, very affordable and felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Linnea H
Reviews.Content: The staff was incredibly helpful to us as we arrived after an early morning flight on a freezing cold January day. They gave us tea, and we were allowed to check in before noon. They also helped with our mixed up airlines reservations, and suggested places nearby to eat. The room was lovely, with pale green walls and gold curtains with sun shining in. The bed was comfy with soft sheets and duvet. We had to leave very early, so never got to see the breakfast room, but they arranged a shuttle to the airport for us and had coffee and cake for us at 3 a.m. Very pleasant place to be in between two long flights and great location in Sultanhamet, behind Blue Mosque and Arasta Market.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect balance of value, location, comfort and service.”
Reviews.Author: Baasoo
Reviews.Content: My wife and twin 8 yr old boys stayed for 4 days at Artefes. The most amazing part of the stay was the morning breakfast in the restaurant on the top floor, with a view overlooking the whole city and sea of Marmara. It really got the day started just right. We weren't in the hotel most of the day but we would sometimes come back to the restaurant and terrace for a quick evening tea and recharge. The night view of the beautifully lit Blue Mosque was also amazing. The staff - from the front desk through to the restaurant and the cleaning staff, all were equally kind and good at what they were doing. The rooms were very clean. We even had an incident where one of the other guests, mistakenly took our suitcase from the reception. The hotel manager was spectacular in his effort to correct the situation. All in all Istanbul is a great city and Artefes is a great place to enjoy this city from. It strikes a perfect balance between affordability, location, comfort and service.

Reviews.Title: “An overpriced deceiving option in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SergeyMarkoff
Reviews.Content: Dirty carpets and reception, total lack of professionalism from the staff, rooms in a pitiful state (they'll try to put you in the worse ones first) those are the words to describe this hotel from which i excpected much better. The description on Expedia is extremely misleading. They state rooms have bath thubs - they don't; they state the hotel has a complimentary SPA, yet you have to pay 10 EUR per hour to use the same... All in all, to be short, a hotel to be definitely better avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hospitality and location”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Geologist
Reviews.Content: This is a nice small hotel located just blocks away from the Blue Mosque & Aye Sophia. More than the hotel or its breakfast, what we liked the most was the hospitality of the staff and its Manager (Mr. Murat). Murat made sure that we had an enjoyable vacation and took care of anything and everything. We stayed there for 6 days over the New Years and took two rooms, one of them being the only suite they have. The suite is a medium sized (in an European sense) room with a balcony overlooking the Sea of Marmara. Watched Sunrise from bed and just walked over for a nice breakfast on the roof. Our children's room was a double - small by American standard and medium by European standard.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart”
Reviews.Author: Maria_Mads
Reviews.Content: When we arrive at the Artefes hotel in Istanbul we were received with a fantastic warmth and friendliness by all staff. We immediately felt welcome at this little homely hotel perfectly situated in a quiet street, overlooking the Marmara sea and just 5 minutes walk from all the main historical attractions.You can actual see the Blue mosque from the restaurant and the top terrace. The room was fair, clean and cool in the authentic Ottoman style. The hotel reception sold us a wonderful halfday boattrip with stops on the Asian side of Istanbul and the Maiden tower that we can really recommend to truely understand the size of this magnificent city. On our departure day we got a late check-out without no discussion. On the down side - The orange juice machine is ready for an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Artefes Hotel- istanbul”
Reviews.Author: catgal_11
Reviews.Content: My friends and I loved this charming, quaint hotel in the heart of the historic district. We especially loved the rooftop where guests had breakfast, or drinks and enjoyed the beautiful Bosporus view. The food was delightful and Turkish Baths really relaxed you. The masseuse, Fatima, was friendly and fun. The staff were all very friendly and made us feel so at home. It was a perfect place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Grazie Mr Murat!”
Reviews.Author: piccolohotel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just five minutes walking from the major historical attractions. Room are comfortable and clean, good international breakfast and nice staff. A special thanks to the Manager Mr Murat that made our journey in Istanbu unforgettable. We stayed in the suite that is wonderful: sea view, Jacuzzi in the room, large bathroom with big shower box, kettle with tea and sugar, courtesy kit. We will come back to Artefes Hotel on our next holiday in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to stay in Istanbul City!”
Reviews.Author: MrTravelMalaysia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights at the end of Sept. 2011. The weather is perfect for vacation. Sunny but cool. We arrived Istanbul from Malaysia in the early morning. Although, our check in time is around 2.00pm, the Hotel was kind enough to allow us to check-in at 9.00 am without any extra charge. Although the room is quite small but it is comfortable and clean. The rooftop restaurant for breakfast has an excellent view of the Marmara Sea. In fact, we can see the Blue Mosque from the rooftop restaurant. We love having breakfast on the rooftop with birds flying around. The hotel is just a walking distance to the central tourist attraction like the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “A one of a kind ( intimate) hotel of a renovated Ottoman house”
Reviews.Author: Manuel F
Reviews.Content: for this discriminative - but non fussy...- traveller, Ä°stanbul's Artefes Hotel provides a one of a kind ( intimate) - classy - atmosphere which is very much needed in these overblown wannabe kind of days. I do feel so Western-Ottoman-Turkish when I go to Artefes...The staff is great. The manager, Murat Tas, is a class act of multidimensional gifts. And Artefe's premises and location are a knock out...

Reviews.Title: “Artefes Hotel = Family”
Reviews.Author: Ayesha Z
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Artefes Hotel! It was central to many tourist attractions (5 minute walk to everything) All of the hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. We stayed in their suite, which was spacious and comfortable. The daily breakfast buffet was plentiful, but the same items daily. The artefes was just like visiting grandma's - large house with many guests visiting, with not a lot of time for detailed cleaning. So ignore the dust bunnies and see the sights!

Reviews.Title: “staff were exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Tillyq
Reviews.Content: Great location to walk to all attractions in old city. Highlight is the lovely rooftop terrace from which to watch sunset with drink in hand or to have breakfast and watch boat traffic going into Bosphorous. Manet or the other staff were always on hand, organised some good guides/trips and gave us a decent discount when we returned for a 2nd time. Discount for cash and there is an ATM just around the corner in another hotel. Breakfast generous, tea-making anytime, rooms comfortable enough- although not very exciting. The free transfers if you stay 3 nights save quite a bit (we had been quoted 85 E for 2 transfers(domestic and international) by another hotel. The hotel was full but we didn't see many people or hear noise.

Reviews.Title: “Maistovi-CR”
Reviews.Author: Isabeltv
Reviews.Content: I was in the Artefes Hotel in Istanbul, Turkey, and I want to share with the readers of this page my unforgettable experience. The Artefes Hotel is a very beautiful and elegant hotel, is very comfortable and provides options to stay comfortably in it. It has a terrace with a spectacular view over the Marmara Sea. Artefes Hotel is located in the center of Istanbul, near to the best tourist places to visit and can make the journey on foot. The attention received by their staff, especially Murat, were splendid. We had a good host, with your help we were not only well in the Hotel Artefes, but also in our stay in Turkey. I really recommend it to tourists, the Artefes Hotel in Istanbul, Turkey, and I take this opportunity to thank all the attention received. Iâ€™ll would like to comeback some day.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in the middle of Sultanamet”
Reviews.Author: helenben_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Artefas hotel for 6 nights and think itÂ´s a nice and friendly place to stay in during a vacation in Istanbul. Very helpfull staff and nice surrondings. At night it was quiet as on the countryside in Sweden. We were a family of three persons and the room was ok for us. Our son has got celiaki and need special bread that the hotel arranged after a e-mail in advance.

Reviews.Title: “"felt at home"”
Reviews.Author: naomi g
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel. My teenage children changed rooms (at my request) so that they could be adjacent to mine and this did not pose any problem at all. The beds were really comfortable and the linen was white and clean. The hotel was situated on a quiet road ( had researched this beforehand) and it was quiet. We felt safe in the area and we were able to walk everywhere and try different restaurants every evening which is part of the holiday. The hotel staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly and spoke good English. They were obviously keen that we have an enjoyable stay. The views from the roof terrace were memorable. Just one slight quibble, I would have loved fresh orange juice and freshly brewed coffee for breakfast but there was ample to eat. Be warned, the massage is a swedish massage so there is no drifting off to sleep in the middle of this. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The Somers Family Cardiff, Uk

Reviews.Title: “OK - Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martin E
Reviews.Content: Like many others who might be reading this review, i did the same before i booked it. Was a bit disappointed, the hotel was OK and clean. Room facilities were poor, no phone to reception, small TV, reasonable bathroom Staff was helpful Don't book the massage at the hotel, its a rip off, you can get it cheaper down the road. My wife caught the reception staff watching inappropriate material on the PC when we came back late one night and he rushed to minimise it. Would i stay there again, perhaps no. It was a reasonable hotel, nice breakfast and view from terrace. That's the main good points. The hotel booked me a taxi to the airport who ripped me off, the meter came to 27TL and he demanded 40TL. Could not be bothered to argue with him, so paid. Was a big disappointment to the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Feel well and enjoy the old city”
Reviews.Author: H_seyin_G130
Reviews.Content: I stayed at many hotels in Sultanahmet( Old city-Istanbul) but in Artefes it was really easy going and totally relaxed. very friendly and helpful staff. The Hotel Roof is amazing with its sight overlooking at Marmara Sea ( and the Islands) and the blue Mosque

Reviews.Title: “Jane from UK”
Reviews.Author: Jane M
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed 5 nights in early Sep 2011. I got the hotel through a Lonely Planet site which said that it was a good, dependable, moderately priced hotel. I thought it was better than that. The reasons are: it is spotlessly clean; the staff couldn't be more helpful and friendly (but not obsequious or over the top) lovely breakfast and the stunning roof terrace. The quiet position between the Blue Mosque and the sea is ideal. If I ever go back I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable, pleasurable and memorable hotel experience in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: gokhanermerak
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of being a guest of the beautiful Artefes Hotel for the fourth time. As a regular traveller to Istanbul, I can easily say that this warm boutique hotel in the middle of Istabul's historic peninsula is the best hotel experience I have had in Istanbul. The hotel experience is about location, comfort and service. Artefes Hotel gets 10/10 in all three. Its location in the Sultanahmet district means its in the most touristic region of the city and within convenient reach of any part of Istanbul using public transport. Within walking distance to shops, bazaars and touristic facilities, its location simply allows one to reach in any direction of Istanbul without expensive or multi connecting means of transportation. Put simply, this translates into time saving. Artefes has offered me a 5 star comfort level consistently - my fourth stay in this hotel is a testament to this fact. Beautiful and practical rooms, a welcoming and warm breakfast environment, and a terrace for your morning or evening tea or coffee, with a view of the Marmara Sea - the comfort offered was simply outstanding and immensely pleasurable. Ultimately however, its all about service, and Artefes again scored 5 stars from me. Its staff share a set of common qualities that one notices right from the initial encounter: Friendliness, the willingness to help and pure professionalism in their dealings with guests. You will notice this with your first contact with the Artefes reception desk - you'll feel welcome straightaway. The attention is personalised and your needs are anticipated. The feeling you will have is that, its your home away from home, but theres always a friendly and willing person to assist you with any issues you may have. I have had a very comfortable and wonderful holidaying experience in Istanbul. Artefes was definitely a major contributor to this pleasurable stay. I would strongly recommend Artefes to any traveller to Istanbul. To me its location, comfort and service are unrivalled.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Fabio M
Reviews.Content: We have been there for a couple of days in August 2011.The place is near the blue Mosque in a silent quartier rich of wooden houses and wonderful corners. Our room was clean. The roof terrace is wonderful. From above it is possible to see the sea and the Mosque. The service is good and the price is right. I absolutely recommend this hotel. Fabio Manfredini

Reviews.Title: “Good position”
Reviews.Author: RomaSnake
Reviews.Content: Good position to visit the must important place of the city, the room are confortable and silent. During the summer breakfast are served on a terrace with a wonderful view. Good price and the personnel are very professional and corteous. One problem is that air conditioning doesn't work when there is nobody in the room and during the summer you can find the room very hot.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: UKFinn56
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in Sultanahmed, in a good safe location near all the key sights in Istanbul. Well equipped rooms, delicious breakfast and a breakfast room with wonderful views! The only thing I missed was a bar! This could easily be accommodated on the spacious roof terrace, which is currently woefully under-used. My sister-in-law and I enjoyed a drink at a nearby bar on our way to the hotel in the evenings, when we would much rather have had one on our own rood terrace! I hope to go back to Istanbul next year and will stay at the same hotel, provided a bar is by then up-and-running.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and service”
Reviews.Author: rwrohwer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artesfes July 30 to August 5, 2011. Very good service from all the staff and they were very helpful. Breakfast was satisfactory and plenty to eat. The terrace view at the top is outstanding and a great place to unwind after a day of sight seeing. They also serve dinner at the terrace. Rooms were compact but more than adequate space. Rooms and bathrooms were clean. AC was satisfactory also. The room stayed cool once we were in the room to activate the system with our key. Playground next door and the street below got a little loud in the evening (due to Ramadan) so earplugs were handy. We would definitely stay here again. R and G

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing terrace view”
Reviews.Author: JTSeattle
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at Hotel Artefes. It is close to everything in the Sultanahmet area. The staff were pleasant, hard working, and spoke English well. Rooms were clean, beds were a little on the hard side but fine. Good wifi. The greatest treasure was the roof top terrace with the stunning view of Istanbul and the Marmet Sea. Complementary breakfast up there was a treat. And you can order dinner up there as well. We spent a great five days there and certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: Travelingtheworld07
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a very good price. The roof top terrace is the highlight! The 360 views of the sea and city are fabulous. The rooms are comfortable and clean with modern bath facility. The staff is helpful, courteous and welcoming. The location is excellent -- 5 minutes to key historic sites and shopping. We had a great stay and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, extremely helpful staff"”
Reviews.Author: AndreaDBucharest
Reviews.Content: The location is in the proximity of the Blue Mosque, in walking distance to all the major touristic objectives. Rooms clean, a bit crowded. Breakfast was very good with a delicious selection of cheese assortments, dried & fresh fruit, veggies, cakes. Staff was probably the nicest we ever met, extremely helpful and forward-coming. Overall a very nice, comfy and feel-at-home experience - we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “nice...”
Reviews.Author: robbgogoss
Reviews.Content: staff is helpful, location is perfect and price is ok for all.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint = Old, Shabby”
Reviews.Author: madame-travel
Reviews.Content: Great location, few minutes walking distance to many popular tourist attractions- Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar, Arista Bazar, Topkapi(sp), etc. Many good restaurants near by. Wonderful rooftop views and welcome drink a nice extra, staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast ok- boiled eggs, melon, cheeses, breads, coffee, tea, cold cereal, dry oats, fruit syrups. Few amenities, free wifi nice, but really the norm around Turkish restaurants/bars/cafes. Very basic, old bathroom, very outdated room & furnishings. Entire room could use a thorough cleaning. Small refrigerator, little/no vanity/counter space. Nice to have slippers provided, but they were covered in dirt/hair after 1 day walking in room. Few toiletries- no lotion, conditioner. Dropped a lipstick under the bed- hated to reach under to retrieve it- Eeeww!! Really shabby without the chic, would stay in Sultanahmet area again, just not here.

Reviews.Title: “we will be back”
Reviews.Author: EkbalMoustafa
Reviews.Content: We were four persons, it was our first visit to Turkey, we booked two double rooms from the Official website of the hotel. It is a nice hotel, it is located near all the historical sightseeing (ayasofia-topkapi palace-blue mosque) it is also near sultan Ahmed metro station and all other means of transportation. The stuff is very helpful, friendly and they speak very good English. The breakfast was very good. The room was comfortable and quite but it needs more cleaning The internet connection speed was fast but it goes off sometimes. Ekbal Moustafa

Reviews.Title: “An amazing city and an equally lovely stay at Artefes”
Reviews.Author: cindylim
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Artefes Hotel at 9 am and were directed to the roof terrace with a welcome drink and a breathtaking view. The reception was able to let us have an early check-in to shower and that was most kind of them. We were given maps and pamphlets and one of the staff, Tuncay even walked with us all the way to the Grand Bazaar. Our room had a view of the Marmara Sea and you could sit on the terrace to unwind at the end of a sight-seeing day. Artefes is accessible and a short walk to the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia Museum. There are restaurants within a stone's throw. We were recommended by the hotel staff to take a Full-Day Tour which included a Cruise on the Golden Horn, the Bosphorus and cable car to Pierre Loti, Dolmabahce Palace and lunch was provided. We came to Istanbul to celebrate our daughter's birthday and nothing could be more apt than to do so on a sunset cruise on the Bosphurus with dinner, a Belly-dance and Anatolian Dance performances where everyone joined in. We left Istanbul on Saturday morning after a wonderful breakfast and a warm farewell by Manager Murat who is as gracious and kind to us during our 5-day stay at Artefes Hotel. Patsy, Singapore

Reviews.Title: “the hotel made my trip the best trip ever”
Reviews.Author: Reem_sp
Reviews.Content: I went with my family to Artefes hotel on May 25th and what can I say... I loved it! Everybody there was so kind! We stayed 1 week and I can assure you that was the best week of my life.Not exagerating. The stuff were so kind with us, giving us tea every night and very kind. I wish we'd stayed more. I really miss it. The last day I didn't want to leave, it was so sad but I can tell you I'll come back someday because what makes an hotel be comfortable is the people who work there (well, apart of the accomodation, which it was great). I think treatment is what makes you want to come back. Artefes, until next time ;)

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful small hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: annwoodrn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location with views of the water and Blue Mosque from the roof. Most attractions within walking distance and good local restaurants. The staff went above and beyond with their assistance and were unfailingly polite and cheerful at all hours of the day. Rooms on the small side but clean and quiet. Have already recommended this hotel to friends who are visiting Istanbul next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and close to nearby sights.”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Five
Reviews.Content: I only spent two nights here but enjoyed my stay and highly recommend this hotel for those traveling on a budget. Room was clean, bed was comfortable, and the water pressure in the shower was excellent. The rooftop terrace was empty almost every time I went up there - either to enjoy morning coffee or at sunset when the surrounding minarets erupted in calls for prayer. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in a lovely city”
Reviews.Author: holgerbensheim
Reviews.Content: the hotel was booked recommended by friends of us their promises were kept excellent breakfast with various types of coffee and tea and vegetables and ...served in the restaurant with a wonderful view to the sea - marvellous the staff is very helpful and polite and can also help you spending an unforgettable day in istanbul clean rooms with decent sanitary equipment and a daily cleaning service (fresh towels daily) I can recommend it to people woh are looking for something small and unique in istanbul -typical turkish

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Desliegh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel end of January for short break, so the weather was very cold! The hotel was lovely & warm & very clean. Rooms big enough for a short stay, a range of toietries supplied,.Staff very helpful. Hotel is very close to all main attractions..5 minute walking distance. Breakfast is great, plenty of everything! Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoLoLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Istanbul and stayed at the excellent Artefes Hotel. This small hotel was very well located in Sultanahmet, just 5 mins walk to the Blue Mosque via a bazaar. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable, has an excellent buffet breakfast included - and located in a top floor room with views across the city and sea. The service is efficient and friendly - we were greeted at th door on arrival and given handy tips and maps on check in. They even let us use their office computer for return flight online check in. Excellent restaurant called Hippodrome just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star, but a good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Serosity
Reviews.Content: First off, the staff here were incredibly helpful - they let us go in the back to use the internet, printed our boarding passes, etc without any charge. They also arranged, canceled and re-arranged our airport car without any complaints. Room was basic (tv was ridiculously small - talking 13 inch, no English channels - but who goes to Instanbul to watch cable anyway?) but more than sufficient. Hotel had an elevator so no heavy lifting. In a great area as well, right in the old city. Breakfast was decent as well. Lots of cheese selection! I would recommend this hotel. Be forewarned - as with any hotel near the Mosque, you will be woken up at 6am by the call to prayer.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location very good view from the terrace”
Reviews.Author: nazdemir
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent as it was right in the centre of the old town a few mins away from the main sites - Blue Mosque, Hagia sophia & Topkapi Palace - good choice of restaurants and the Arasta Bazar. The tram stop was close by which makes travelling around easier and cheaper. The staff were very helpful and courteous. Rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for discovering Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Lis20
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in the old part of the city in a beautiful old building on a narrow cobblestoned street. We walked everywhere from here but there are steep hills so a reasonable level of mobility is essential. The Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, The Grand Bazaar and Topkapi Palace are within a ten to fifteen minute walk as are many restaurants, banks and shopping. The hotel staff were very helpful and attentive, our room was clean if small but we had a great view of the street and a window box with flowers on the mini balcony. The restaurant is on the upper floor and we ate breakfast from the well stocked buffet, looking out at the rooftops, minarets of the Blue Mosque and the busy sea lanes. We stayed during winter so the open rooftop area wasn't in use for dining but the view from there was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Quiet, and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Nonfiction
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in a single room on the first floor. The room was quiet and immaculate. There was hot water at all times. I was so comfortable in the room that I wish I could have stayed here longer. When I arrived, I was offered a free drink so I ordered coffee which was brought to me a few minutes later. The free communal laptop in the lobby with wireless Internet service was a nice convenience. Also, I had a handheld device with me and was able to pick up free wireless from the hotel this way, too. The breakfast upstairs on the terrace was lovely, and the staff replenished the breakfast buffet throughout the morning. The staff was wonderful! I communicated with the hotel prior to my arrival to inquire about transportation between the hotel and the airport. The hotel helped me arrange this and they did so at a competitve price, which was much appreciated. At one point during my stay I asked the front desk for a sewing kit and they provided this with no problem. When I'm able to return to Istanbul, I will definitely stay here again. Artefes was a great place to call home for my two nights in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, beautiful hotel that is within walking distance to all of Istanbulâ€™s best sights!”
Reviews.Author: SarahS28
Reviews.Content: I am late in writing my review - since I stayed at The Artefes Hotel in late September. I have never written a review on tripadvisor, but felt compelled after staying at such a lovely hotel. The rooms were quaint with wood floors, wood shutters, stone in the bathroom and a relaxed simple elegance. The hotel is small enough that it feels like home when you come back at the end of a long day and not an enormous unwelcoming standard hotel. The roof top terrace is beautiful for breakfast and has a perfect view of Sultanahmet. I have seen reviews that say the bathrooms are not clean enough, and the breakfasts werenâ€™t good enough, and after staying here I have serious doubts that the hotel is to blame rather than the travelerâ€™s poor attitudes. I was totally content with the breakfast buffet and found it to be satisfying and to have a fine assortment of foods. When we first arrived we were placed in a room with two twin beds, and when we asked for a room with one larger bed they were more than happy to make sure we were comfortable and at ease during our stay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “good position, nice view for the terrace”
Reviews.Author: umbe72
Reviews.Content: good ratio quality/price. Breakfast could be improved. Turkish bath was not working duirng our staying

Reviews.Title: “good location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelibrarian
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights and was quite pleased with the hotel. I found the staff really helpful (I had a couple of phone calls to make and they were kind enough to step in and translate when my really bad Turkish skills failed me.) Great location - be sure to go to the Yeni Marmara cafe across the street. Rooms were well heated and had good water pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul is a beautiful city with lots to offer”
Reviews.Author: Windshadow4
Reviews.Content: Very Friendly and helpful staff. Recommended and arranged outings, downloaded Skype so I could make phone calls, help luggage for us while we did some travelling outside Istanbul. Would highly recommend this hotel it has a wonderful location near a lot of major sites; Blue Mosque, Hippodome, Museums, Grand Bazar, Spice Market and churches, etc. All within walking distance. Lots of good restaurants and shopping in the area.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I ever have experienced in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sommermari
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel have the perfect location, where you can walk to all the most famous touristattractions in the old part of Istanbul. The staff are very serviceminded and they all speak very good english. The receptionists are also very helpfull. If you want to book a tour ore need tranfer to the airport. The Breakfirst are very luxery and all the facilities at the hotel, steambath,sauna, hamam and fitnessroom work perfectly and all room are very delicate decoratet. I feet I really found a hotel where I have to come again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: benjamin1996
Reviews.Content: Me and my family loved staying at Artefes hotel. :) The service was very nice and the rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: msahba
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in Istanbul, much thanks to Artefes hotel. The staff was very helpful, and made sure all of our needs were taken care of at all times. The location was great! The hotel was in walking distance to almost everything. Even though the location is very central, there is a quiet atmosphere surrounding the hotel. The breakfast buffet was always something to look forward to. One of the hightlights of our trip was sitting down in the morning, eating our breakfast, while enjoying the great view that the restaurant provided. Thank you so much for a lovely stay. We're sure to come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Not A 4 STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: OptimusEdmonton
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Turkey with a group of friends - we booked 4 rooms at the Artefes. I was a bit put off because when I arrived to register, I was informed that since my room was prepaid, they were not interested in ensuring that I received a good room. My friend, who had not prepaid, received the best room in the hotel for less money than I paid. My room was what I would expect in a hostel or pension - extremely small, two tiny, low beds, window facing wall of another building so no air movement or light and creaky floors. The room was very clean and the bathroom was excellent. The breakfast was very good, except for the stale pastries which were easy to avoid as there was lots of selection. The coffee was excellent. Great location and wonderful rooftop patio. Except for my check-in, the staff was always friendly and helpful. When we had a problem with a noisy party in an adjacent room, they dealt with it promptly and successfully.

Reviews.Title: “Wise Choice, Bad situation”
Reviews.Author: karim2010
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location (i would choose to be beside Sultan Ahmet area instead of Taksim square), quite place, very good breakfast, the room is average (not a 4 start room) and some rooms don't have enough sun light, the staff is average too ... they changed our room and moved our luggage to the new room while we are away without our permission, anyway if you would like a to have a good package of money/service and you are not willing to stay in the hotel too much, i recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “The hotel has great staff and bar none, the best roof-top patio.”
Reviews.Author: oddly257
Reviews.Content: I travelled here with my family, five in total, and we had the pleasure of staying here for a week. The hotel is clean, bright and has great staff, Our front desk manager in particular, Speedy Gonzales, nicknamed for his cheerfulness and zippy service, was a treasure. Kudos and best regards to Speedy. Volcan,who is general manager also got our vote for his knowlege and professionalism. We were on a mission to find the best roof-top patio and this hotel has it! We must have run up and down 50 flights of stairs and various hotels in town to find it, but, we found it. The hotel while centrally located in the Sultanahmet has a totally unrestricted view of both the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara. There is no hotel blocking the view,no trees,nothing except incredible view. Thank-you to all at the Artefes hotel for making our stay wonderful. We will recommend this hotel to our friends as we are airline staff. We will be back! Audrey, Ann, Rachael and Michele

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Hotel. Below even any backpacker standard.”
Reviews.Author: Tantomile_11
Reviews.Content: The staff were helpful but not proactive. The hotel room was filthy, especially the bathroom, every corner was covered with black mould. Wardrobe had not be cleaned - dust and crumbs in a drawers, 1 hanger in wardrobe. Floors squeaked all over the hotel - and you could hear them all when trying to sleep. Walls were paper-thin - with holes where plaster should have been (half hidden behind the furniture). I did not get 1 decent nightâ€™s sleep while I was there. Breakfast was atrocious â€“ they served stale leftovers on consecutive days. I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. The wireless internet did not work anywhere but the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, couldn't recommend it more”
Reviews.Author: Bobrebour
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel, with great staff and a good location. It's close enough to walk to all the sites but further enough away for it to be quiet and not as touristy as up on the main drag. The breakfast was great, staff were friendly and the room was a twin, even though I paid a single rate, which was nice. Spa, sauna etc were not yet built when I stayed, but looked half finished... A word of warning is that it's a little tricky to find. You have to turn off the main street (the one the address is given as, and then cut down past the playground, heading downhill).

Reviews.Title: “simple but really enough if you want simple”
Reviews.Author: spartaqus
Reviews.Content: i was in istanbul for a meeting and look around 2 days hotel is close to center of istanbul- taksim-beyoglu and blue mosque breakfast is really good staff is good and helpfull . i want to thank for nilufer , she helped me much

Reviews.Title: “very clean hotel and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: Brussels44
Reviews.Content: i was in istanbul at may, this was second time and my hotel was good again i would like to say , view is cool , close to city center,blue mosque , taksim breakfast is very diffrent and good also staff is helpfull , specially nilufer was great

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the area, economic, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: riotraveller_2
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel last month for business travel and i was very happy with the hotel. First of all and the most importan criteria for me is that it was very clean. The location was great just walking distance to the business center and major tourist attractions of Istanbul. The staff was very friendly. I slept late and was almost missing my plane, the staff gave me a ride to the airport. I will definitely stay in this hotel in my future visits to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location at a very good price”
Reviews.Author: marek-krakau
Reviews.Content: Artefes is a centrally located hotel in the Sultanahmet district. Very good location offers various numbers of historical attractions, all in walking distance, near to the main sighting of Istanbul (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi). From Ataturk airport 30 minutes by taxi. This is one of the Special Boutique hotels, a renovated old wooden Ottoman building, with flowers everywhere. The room had all facilities you can expect from such a hotel, very clean and well furnished. The staff were very friendly and helpful about the city, they couldn't do enough for us. Breakfest (included in the room rate) is served on rooftop terrace with a view to die for! Great hotel for the price. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: brasil_traveler2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel in June 2010. The location was great, very close to major tourist attractions like blue mosque, Sultanahmet, Topkapi palace. The rooms were very clean the staff was very helpful and the view from the suit rooms in the hotel was excellent. The breakfast was very rich and you can find many different tastes of Turkish food. I definitely recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location in a quiet part of town.”
Reviews.Author: Charleygirl76
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked the hotel as part of a flight-hotel package with Expedia, and we chose the hotel for it's reviews and proximity to the Blue Mosque, and was in the old part of Sultanahmet. Hotel was clean, friendly and functional for our long weekend stay. Room was nicely furnished and although looked out out onto a narrow street it was quiet - especially at night. Breakfast was sufficient and to be expected in this part of the world - meats, cheese, fruit, veg, cereal and breads. Lovely setting on the roof terrace with views of The Blue Mosque & the sea. Our only issues with the room were a dodgy shower head that sprayed water from the sides, and the TV was not working / picking up any signal. For what we paid, and the service of the staff and the location I would reccomend this hotel to others. Use their shuttle to get you back to the hotel. Nice big people carrier. Only 40TL .

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravelbug1977
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located close to some of the major attractions. The rooms are very clean and I was very impressed by the handy amenities in the bathroom i.e. toothbrush/paste, shaving kit. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the breakfast impressive. Make sure you sit on the roof top garden and you will overlook the Marmara Sea, with good views of The Blue Mosque & the Asian side of Istanbul. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good place, good location”
Reviews.Author: StockTraderReading
Reviews.Content: I'd normally expect more from a 4 start hotel but except the squeeky parquet in the room and the size of the room a bit small all was really perferfect. The bathroom was nice and clean. The cleaning service accurate. The staff very kind and helpful and the breackfast really nice! So: good price, good location, good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely staff, tasty breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: sneakerfan
Reviews.Content: My parents and I visited Istanbul for 3 days and wanted to see as much as possible during our stay. The hotel is located in Sultanahmet, just around the corner from the Blue Mosque, so we within walking distance of a lot of the sights. The staff were friendly and very helpful, especially Sergio and Medeyin. They helped us with all aspects of our stay, including good places to eat, tours, and free maps. The breakfast buffet was delicious, lots of cheese, fruit, juice, cereal, eggs and bread. It made for a great start to the day! You can eat breakfast outside on the terrace and enjoy a good view of the Blue Mosque and the sea. The room itself was quite basic but very clean and with everything we needed - air conditioning, kettle, tv, fridge, and safe. I would definitely stay here again as they made me and my parents feel very welcome, and helped us get the most of our short stay in beautiful Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, weird service...”
Reviews.Author: lmingwall
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice although they were going through major renovations at the time of our stay. It states tub/shower combination but it is only a shower which was a bit disappointing. We had local friends that came by the hotel to pick us up and to visit us. The hotel would not allow our friends in our room with us. I didn't understand it or why - maybe it is a Turkish thing? It was kind of strange given we weren't engaging in any rowdy behavior. I guess they may not have liked American women hanging out with Turkish men????

Reviews.Title: “absolutely recommendabel hotel”
Reviews.Author: uyus
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean rooms;very friendly personal enormus helpfull. you can reache every intresting spot walking distance; ....see your self jou won't regret

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay. I really liked it”
Reviews.Author: kadiravci
Reviews.Content: I was there in December for vacations. Nice and clean rooms. Very good service. Nice personal. If you are looking for a hotel near city centre, its optimal. You can reach every interesting spot in nearest time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinetravels78
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Artfes for 3 nights. It's in a great location within the old walled city with plenty of restaurants to choose from in the vicinity, narrow streets and cobbles. All the sights are within easy walking distance - Blue Mosque, Sofia, the Palace, the Cistern. The Grand Bazaar and Spice Souk if you don't mind walking is only about 20 minutes walk up the main street. The call to prayer during the night can be heard from the hotel, quite eerie when you hear it for the first time in the middle of the night. The room was spacious, comfortable beds, clean and made up everyday. The breakfast room on the roof terrace has great views of the mosque and the sea, food was basic but good to start you off for the day. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful with very good knowledge of the area and sights. There are a few local places to eat for authentic food - namely DoyDoy. There's a small pretty bazaar 5 minutes away near the mosque for hassle free shopping for gifts. Try the Turkish Delight sisha - very good and pomegranate tea rather than the apple. The Spice Souk is a good place to visit and slightly cheaper than the Grand Bazaar. Istanbul is a lovely place to visit, chilled out with lots to see and good atmosphere. It can be pricey as it's a tourist hot spot but wander around and you can get best prices for food, drink and gifts.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: vlinsanity
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel and very friendly service, many thanks to Ozan and Medeni for their hospitality. Hotel is located near the Blue Mosque and other sights, only few minutes walk to the tram station from which main destinations can be reached easily. Absolutely recommendable. Greetings from Hamburg! :)

Reviews.Title: “good place and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: fearofdarkness
Reviews.Content: We have stay here twice, on our trips to Turkey. This time we also visited Istanbul. The rooms are big! The kids sleep in the front room on a fold out bed with TV. The hotel is very clean with very nice linens. The kids love the nightly cookies and milk, and breakfast is great. Also this hotel close to center of istanbul, but where parking can be difficult. Stuff was great especially thanks for nilufer

Reviews.Title: “Sall, reasonable, pleasant”
Reviews.Author: lifeabroad
Reviews.Content: Small hotel room, adequate but not tiny, bathroom again small but not impossible, rates fair, breakfast upstairs nice, staff friendly, one internet computer in lobby

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place ;)”
Reviews.Author: NAL_London
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Artfes...the location was really good and near to the main sighting of Istanbul. The hotel's rooms were clean and tidy, the view on the roof top was breathtaking and very romantic. The staff were helpful they did make some calls for us when we needed help, and they speak good English. The best thing I loved about the hotel was the Breakfast it was very tasty and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “very helpfull stuff”
Reviews.Author: Sy122
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a visit to Turkey and a great stay at Artefes hotel. I realize that hotels get numerous letters complaining about many things, and get but a few thanking the staff for a job well done. This act of courtesy made our visit complete and reaffirmed what we learned during our stay, that the Turkish people are great hosts and very friendly to the foreign visitors. Breakfast was fresh and delicious at Artefes The staff was great! particularly thanks for nilufer

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed staying at Istanbul and this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oc_blgm
Reviews.Content: We have had a really nice stay at the hotel. The staff was very helpful, particularly thanks for Nilufer. Our room was good, after we managed relatively quickly to get it changed to one with views on the avenue (not noisy). The hotel is about 10 minutes away from the historic center (you need to take a tramor cab), very near to a charming and very Turkish part of the town. We felt secure there and it was nice to walk around and see not only tourists, but normal people. We would choose this hotel again without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms OK, but staff and location great!”
Reviews.Author: jonmelsa
Reviews.Content: We were my fiancee, her sister and I, and we stayed from Oct 06th to Oct 11th in a triple room for 99 Euros per night. Like many others have pointed out, the rooms are good but basic. A little mold in the showers, but otherwise good. Also, the breakfast is solid and is served ontop of the hotel, with fab 360 degree views, with the Blue Mosque within a spits distance. The point is to be outside as much as possible and see as much of this beautiful city as you can! As mentioned, the blue mosque is really close, so is the Hippodrome and Hagia Sophia. Would reccommend getting tram chips ("Jeton's") and walking from Sultanmeht, either via Blue Mosque or via the Hippodrome. The cafe across the street is also a little find. Looks a bit dodgy from the outside, but a gem if you go all the way in. Great views of the ocean and a garden with Pommegranate trees and reasonably priced Nargile (waterpipe).

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Sawaddee
Reviews.Content: The Artefes was the only hotel which appeared on both our hotel choices list and that of a travel agent friend, so having read the comments on here we made a booking. The location is tremendous, being within easy walking distance of all the main sights of Sultanhamet, yet in a quiet, mostly residential street with very little traffic and the excellent Istanbul tram service only a short walk away. The roof terrace has the Blue Mosque one one side and the Sea of Marmara and views of the Bosphorus on the other, a perfect location when you want to relax. The hotel itself has an adequate lobby and is decorated to a very high standard, with a lot of thought in the designs and considerable Turkish influence throughout. We were very pleased to discover it was perhaps the cleanest hotel we had ever stayed at, absolutely squeaky clean and was always maintained that way during our week long stay. Our room was typical of Turkish hotels and a little on the small side, but perfectly adequate and like the rest of the hotel kept totally clean with a constant supply of fresh linen and towels. The bathroom was small but again adequate and as a hospital inspector I can say it was very, very clean, even in those places most people don't dare to look. The breakfast buffet service was very comprehensive with a constant supply of food. The basic things were always there, again typically Turkish with breads, cheeses and meats, accompanied by yoghurt, cakes and cereals as well as hot foods. Each day the regular items were supplemented by a choice of other dishes which provided excellent variety and a chance to try something new each day. The best thing about the hotel however are the staff. Everyone without exception was very friendly and keen to provide an excellent service which they all did, especially Tunjai who gave us some fantastic ideas about where to go, how to get there and what to see. He made our holiday a really fantastic trip. It's a privately owned hotel and the owner is there on hand at any time to chat to you although you'll probably think he's just another member of staff - again ensuring your time there is everything you want it to be. It has top hotel service but with a friendly feeling which the big hotels miss out. We felt at home. We've stayed in hotels the world over, but this one is a real gem and so deserves our mark of excellent - I'd strongly recommend it to anyone, we had such a good time there.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: BAIGMR
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife recently stayed four nights while on excursion trip to Istanbul. We enjoyed staying at this hotel specially being very close to the tourist ares. The breakfast was wholesome and nice. Staff were extremely helpfull, specially Volkan and the staff at the counter. I think it is the best deal for the price we paid. M.R.BAIG

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality and service hard to beat for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Frankfort
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights here. I enjoyed my stay very much, not only because of the affordable and excellant accomodations, but also because of the friendliness and hospitality of the staff. Two of them - Servet and Hulya, were especially helpful and kind - helping us with recommendations, directions and the language. All staff should be commended for fine service. James Monsour USA

Reviews.Title: “manifique”
Reviews.Author: MuratBrussels
Reviews.Content: manifique hotel!!!! great personel.realy clean and friendly.I realy enjoyed the time there.Next time sure I'll be there again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull hotel and fantastÄ±c”
Reviews.Author: jack12Ukrayna
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel and very nice teracce breakfast is on the top floor teracce and very freÅŸh breakfast you look marmara sea and blue mosc very nice view staffs is teh friendly and helpfull between employees who help me thank you medanÄ±

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xochitlmir
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice hotel with friendly people, good service and excellant food at a good price, you should consider Artefes Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very satisfactory hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brussels44
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were always helpful and courteous. Breakfast was plentiful, with a good variety that changed slightly each day. The rooms were clean and towels changed daily. . Safe included with room. We ate in the hotel one night and the meal was excellent. And the Sultanamet is only 5 minutesby away. I have no real complaint at all about Hotel Artefes and would happily stay there again if visiting Istanbul in the future,also special thanks for nilufer , she was very helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Beware...”
Reviews.Author: Skibum9
Reviews.Content: Whilst staying in Artefes Hotel with my wife and a couple of friends, I became rather bemused by all the lavish praise for the hotel on Tripadvisor as our experience certainly wasn't living up to expectations. So I looked at the reviews a little more closely and realised that all the positive 5 star reviews are from people with only 1 contribution on Tripadvisor. Also, despite some of them claiming to be American (and so presumably native English speakers), most of them seem to make the same basic grammatical mistakes as one another! The truth is that this is a very basic hotel but I guess you get what you pay for. The rooms are clean but not impeccably so e.g. the floor is not hoovered every day etc. The claim that they have aircon is a joke. Not only is it totally ineffective when it's on, but the electricity in the room only works when the key is in a slot by the door, so it's off all day while you're out and the room becomes a sauna! Wi-fi access is another exaggerated claim. It only works in one half of the lobby although I did have intermittent access to a random network next door from my room. Breakfast, so often praised by other reviewers, was terrible and we ignored it on most days. Terrible bread, limited choice of fruit (just some watermelon and grapes). Processed meat and cheese and a basic cold scrambled eggs and fried sausage selection. They also don't seem to replenish the buffet as it gets eaten so you have to arrive early to have any chance of finding something half-way decent. The staff are nice and very helpful and speak decent English, but be careful of taking any of their recommendations. The reception staff will push all manner of tours on you and against our better judgement we accepted one which promised a Bosphorous cruise along with tours of a couple of palaces (unfortunately I can't remember the name of the operator). The tour started late and so missed out one of the palaces. However, they did find time to effectively kidnap everyone and take us to a leather wholesaler in the middle of nowhere, where they forced us to watch a "fashion show" and tried to hard sell us leather jackets!! The hotel staff clearly know the tours are rubbish as once we returned they never asked us about our experience and never tried to offer us anything again. Having said that, I would definitely recommend a Bosphorous cruise. Just sort it on your own and avoid the organised tours.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: bulgarian21
Reviews.Content: The Artefes Hotel is a lovely hotel with a very nice dining room. The breakfast was the most extravagent buffet I saw in Turkey - everything one could imagine, including scrambled and fried eggs, sausage, bacon, every imaginable kind of fruit, pancakes, etc. We stayed here as part of a tour, so I can't speak to value for money because I don't know what we paid, but the room was spacious and comfortable, etc. I would prefer to stay up in the Taksim area where there is more nightlife and all-around activity (and you can easily take a taxi to the old city for touristy stuff during the day). But this was very nice. Also i must say stuff is very good and thanx for nilufer

Reviews.Title: “cool location”
Reviews.Author: prime_4322
Reviews.Content: there was a good place and breakfast. also has a good view between the blue mosque. the staff is good especially nilufer was so helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: buggywoogy
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the artefes hotel was superb. The high standards were impressive and the hotel staff were extremely helpful and pleasant, especially the night staff , namely tunjai and madani. I would recommend the hotel to anyone planning a visit to istanbul

Reviews.Title: “great customer service and simply hotel”
Reviews.Author: moldovian
Reviews.Content: this hotel good at stuff and customer relations and ok with service,clean... location is very good close to good shopping centers and blue mosque stuff is interested in with customers they r doing everything to glad you also nilufer was so good for us thx for nilufer

Reviews.Title: “Friendly stuff and good location in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: 18mcnamara18
Reviews.Content: Artefes hotel has got a good stuff , they look like our friends , also breakfast is fresh and delicious , i want to especially thanx for nilufer she was so helpful

Reviews.Title: “good location , close to city center”
Reviews.Author: indian33638
Reviews.Content: i went to istanbul for a business meeting and this hotel close to center of istanbul , bars , shopping places also got a good view and breakfast was delicious staff is friendly , particularly thanks for nilufer

Reviews.Title: “a very unhappy stay”
Reviews.Author: dissapointed4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is totally unsuitable for children. It has a flight of steps at the front which meant that every time we arrived or left the hotel we had to request assistance with the buggies. Breakfast is served on the terrace which is accessed via a tiny lift and another flight of stairs. Because of this difficult access with very young children we usually went without breakfast. No other meals are served in the hotel. We booked a triple room. This was inadequate in size for three beds, 2 adults and 2 children. We could hardly move and there was insufficient storage space and only a tiny toilet bin was provided ,which left us having to use our own plastic bags for nappies and general rubbish. Cleaning of the room was perfunctory. Surfaces in the bathroom were not wiped, the floor not vacuumed and on our last day the room was not cleaned at all and we were left with unmade beds and without fresh towels We have stayed in several hotels in Istanbul and Turkey as a whole, this is the only hotel we have stayed in where children have not been warmly welcomed and were we have felt uncomfortable. The majority of the staff totally lacked warmth and friendliness and we were very glad to leave,

Reviews.Title: “it was a good trip and hotel”
Reviews.Author: quennessie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in good place , so close to good place like; blue mosque,topkapi place and so many shopping center. Also delivery and food are free of problems. I realy liked there. Artefes has a good landscape and view, you can feel good when you drink somethings. Another good point , has a good stuff , particularly thanks for the nilufer.

Reviews.Title: “simply good”
Reviews.Author: VZF
Reviews.Content: Small good hotel close to Sultan Ahmet mosque, etc. and with terrace view of the same and the sea/Bosphorous. (rooms are kind of small, but good value)

Reviews.Title: “Insufferable in the summer”
Reviews.Author: jillomazoo
Reviews.Content: This is an extremely basic hotel without much to offer except a pleasant breakfast room. The A/C they claimed to have was absolutely ineffective, so we spent two sweltering nights with the windows open to the very noisy street. We would have left after the first night if we could have done so without losing our money. In retrospect we should have done it anyway. It may be a more pleasant place during the rest of the year but I would never recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again if it was free”
Reviews.Author: atticus_pf
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Artefes hotel while on holiday in Istanbul. The gap between our expectations based on the hotel website and our actual experience was enormous, and not in a good way. It was very hot during our stay and despite the claims on the hotel website that there was air conditioning, there was no AC - just a vent blowing out warm air into the room. The street outside of the hotel is incredibly noisy until the early morning thus making sleep even more difficult. Also, there are no screens on the windows, which resulted in an abundance of fat mosquitoes in the morning. We asked the staff repeatedly about the AC but they claimed first that we had not operated the equipment right and second that they were repairing the AC. The lobby of the hotel smells like old cigarette smoke. The breakfast was awful - stale off-brand cereal and warm milk, limited or no selection of fruit, limited selection of breads/pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Elegance”
Reviews.Author: travellady912
Reviews.Content: While staying at the Artefes, the room itself was small and quite cozy. It was very good for what we needed. The breakfast in the morning was incredible!!! The view was very beautiful as well!! I loved how everything was set up!! Also the front desk manager Ozan was extremely helpful and very nice! He was able to get us reservations to see the whirling dirvish, and showed us places to go and eat that were native to the Turks, which was even better then the tourist locations! There was also a GREAT leather store walking distance away. It is called True leather. Great place and would strongly reccomend it!

Reviews.Title: “great and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: gubbo74
Reviews.Content: I will highly recommend this hotel because of exceptional customer service. I'm glad I chose Artefes Hotel it's so close to many tourist spots. Breakfast was very good with a great view on roof top. Serdar one of the hotel's crew was really helpful. Allan, San Diego June, 2009

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Artefes knows the art of effective service hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: HEALTHforAllNOW
Reviews.Content: Eleven days at this hotel together with family gives me the right to review with confidence. Everyone at reception went out of their way to provide extraordinary service even in times of duress (such as leaving a three year old's beloved blanket, plane delays and other setbacks from paperwork to translation to map interpretation--all resolved with their smile and effectiveness). Breakfast is excellent. Location could not be better. It is a place to which we will return. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel Amazing city !”
Reviews.Author: Funnyangel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, clean and the people that work in it it's really kind, the breakfast it's very good and plenty of different type of food, sweet, fruits, lot's of kind of bread, eggs and lots more! it's 10 minutes walking from the center, blue mosque, gran bazar, spicy bazar etc etc. thanks again to let me do a wonderful staying there in Istanbul!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation”
Reviews.Author: john_Lei
Reviews.Content: Good accommodations for the price. Clean, neat and quiet rooms and facilities. Staff spoke English and were very friendly and helpful. Clean bathrooms. Very good breakfast. I would come back to this hotel again and recommend it to my friends.
